item.title: Once Human: Every Bow, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Bows in Once Human lack usefulness due to the game's lack of stealth gameplay, making guns more practical choices.
  • The Compound Bow stands out as an effective option for stealth gameplay, offering buffs for distance elimination of foes.
  • While bows may not be the go-to choice for all players, they can still provide viable options for those who enjoy ranged combat.

Once Human is an intriguing survival game that takes many common gameplay features from other successful games and attempts to meld them into a unified whole. This is something the game generally achieves, with a few exceptions, such as the mismatch of graphical styles, and gameplay mechanics that have little use. Bows fit into this last category, unfortunately.

There are only four bows available to players in this horror survival shooter, and this is the first clue that bows, in general, are pretty lackluster in Once Human . The main problem is that the game's stealth gameplay is close to non-existent. There is little benefit to using a silent weapon from range when stealth is simply not a consideration in combat. This means that, in almost every case, a bow will be overshadowed by a gun in Once Human . That being said, there are some players that will enjoy using a bow, and they do have a couple of viable options available to choose from.

4 Rustic Crossbow

Basic Bow

  • How To Get : Every player can craft this basic bow from the start of the game.
  • Specials :
    • None

  • Suggested Weapon Mods :
    • None

Even though most beginners to Once Human eschew a ranged weapon for the first 10 to 15 levels and stick with the basic machete they are given in the tutorial, there is an argument for crafting this basic bow as a companion weapon.

It isnâ€™t powerful, but it takes minimal resources to craft, the blueprint is freely unlocked, and ammo costs are low. Carrying the Rustic Crossbow as a backup weapon gives a player at least some form of ranged damage in the early game. Bows in Once Human take some skill to use properly, so crafting this bow early on can be seen as a good way to practice for using one of the more advanced bows later.

3 Recurve Bow

Workable Silent Ranged Weapon

  • How To Get : Blueprint can be looted from mystical crates in the Broken Delta region.
  • Specials :
    • When crouching and staying still, attack +10%, weak spot damage +15%, stacking up to 3 times.
    • This effect will be removed when you stand up, move around, or hit a target.

  • Suggested Weapon Mods :
    • Pinpoint Strike

The Recurve Bow is a viable alternative to a sniper rifle up to the mid-game stage of Once Human . It is very much designed to be used from stealth, with the player taking their time to line up a shot at a weak spot on an enemy.

For Once Human players who prefer melee weapons, carrying a decently calibrated Recurve Bow gives them a lot more flexibility in how they engage enemies. It becomes possible to thin out the herd before closing into melee range. However, for players who enjoy ranged combat, this bow is overshadowed by every sniper rifle in the game.

2 Recurve Crossbow

First Strike Crossbow

  • How To Get : Blueprints can be looted from crates on the open-world map.
  • Specials :
    • Hitting a target's weak spot applies the bull's eye status on the target, and increases all weapons' Crit rate against the target by 30%, lasting 10 seconds.
    • This effect can only be triggered once every 15 seconds on the same target.

  • Suggested Weapon Mods :
    • Pinpoint Strike

As with the previous bow on this list, the Recurve Crossbow makes for a great ranged weapon for players who prefer to use a melee weapon to carry them in Once Human . However, this bow is much better suited for getting a solid, first strike hit on a boss at range before closing into melee range and diving into close-quarters combat.

However, the downside of this bow is that it is something of a one-trick pony, because it has a 15-second cooldown on its primary special. It is unlikely that the player will get a second shot off on a boss, and it is almost impossible to get a third, simply because most boss fights take place on small, instanced maps, making it hard for the player to find a safe spot to shoot from range. That being said, all damage is good damage in a boss fight, and getting a solid hit on a boss from range with this bow is never going to be a bad thing.

1 Compound Bow

Silent Death From Afar

  • How To Get : Blueprint can be looted from crates in the open-world map.
  • Specials :
    • Hitting a target grants temporary reload speed +6, crit rate +10%, stacking up to 3 times. This buff is instantly maxed out upon defeating a target.
    • At full stacks, hitting a target also triggers unstable bomber.

  • Suggested Weapon Mods :
    • Decisive Blow
    • Eruptive Bomber
    • Pinpoint Strike
    • Super Charged

When approaching a point of interest teeming with foes, it is prudent to eliminate a few from a distance before engaging. The Compound Bow excels in this scenario, enhancing stealth gameplay by reducing the likelihood of detection and subsequent attack.

The Compound Bow is particularly effective because dispatching a single enemy activates the weapon's self-buff, boosting reload speed and increasing damage output. Overall, this is the only bow that a player might want to use instead of a sniper rifle, if they run a ranged damage only build. However, the weapon needs to be fully calibrated to reach its maximum effectiveness.

item.title: Once Human: How to Get Combo Chipsets
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Combo Chipsets

In Once Human , the only way to survive and prepare for the later stages is by having access to important resources and in-game currency; Energy Links. While you can slay enemies or explore the wild to get your hands on resources, acquiring Energy Links requires completing quests, commissions and selling items to the NPCs.

Among the items that fetch a high price, Combo Chipsets can be sold for a large sum. Find out more on how to get Combo Chipsets in Once Human with this guide.

How to Get Combo Chipsets

A Combo Chipset is one of those items that can be crafted at an Intermediate Supplies Workbench. However, like many other items in the game, you need to first get the blueprint for this particular Chipset .

How to Unlock Combo Chipset Blueprint

To unlock the blueprint, you will need to focus on your Memetic Specialization nodes . These nodes are usually available at levels 20, 25, 30, and 35 , and can provide the necessary blueprint for certain equipment.

However, this process depends heavily on RNG , thus to acquire Combo Chipset Blueprint, you might have to make multiple attempts. Once you successfully roll for the Combo Chipset node, it will be unlocked and ready for crafting at your Intermediate Supplies Workbench .

How to Craft Combo Chipset

To build a single unit of Combo Chipset, you will need to gather the following resources:

  • 10 Automatic Parts / 15 Rusted Parts / 15 Standard Parts / 12 Special Parts / 12 Refined Parts
  • 20 Metal Scraps
  • 30 Electronic Parts

Fortunately, most of these materials can be collected by looting various items during your exploration and disassembling scrap at Disassembly Bench. Resources like Rusted Parts, Standard Parts, Refined Parts, Special, and Automatic Parts are typically found by disassembling different items . Metal Scraps, on the other hand, can be gathered by disassembling metallic items, which you can find easily in regions like Dayton Wetlands.

Lastly, Electronic Parts can be obtained by disassembling technological items, commonly found in Silo Psi and Chalk Peak regions, and also by defeating Rabizex, the boss of the Monolith of Thirst . Once you have collected all the necessary materials, go to your Intermediate Supplies Workbench and start crafting it. Each Combo Chipset will take 60 seconds to craft.

How to Sell Combo Chipsets

You can sell each Combo Chipset for 12,000 Energy Links. To maximize your profits, you can craft multiple Chipsets, and sell them to different vendors in the game . With multiple town hub vendors available, you can sell up to 20 units of Combo Chipsets per week , earning a total of 240,000 Energy Links . To achieve this, you will need to visit different town hubs to sell your crafted Combo Chipsets and fully utilize the weekly trading limits of each vendor.

item.title: Best Open-World Games For Sailing
item.description:
The sailing genre of games has come into its own with live service games, genre-defining simulators, and more. With so much variety, video games now cater to various groups of sailing fanatics who love voyaging the seven seas in their spare time. Open-world sailing games are especially popular, with sailing fans enjoying the vast openness of the seas from the comfort of their homes.

While sailing games have been around for some time, it has not been until recently that sailing video games have become popular as a leisurely pastime. Many of the best open-world games have included sailing mechanics as their core gameplay. Here are some of the best titles that feature open-world mechanics for nautical exploration.

6 The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker

The Ultimate Cartoon Sailing Experience

The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker is a classic Legend of Zelda game known for its cartoonish sea-faring gameplay. Following a young Link, hundreds of years after the events of Ocarina of Time , Wind Waker had players explore the Great Sea in pursuit of the evil Ganondorf.

After a few hours of restricted linear gameplay, the world opens up, allowing players to visit 49 islands across the game's vast oceanic open world and discover lost treasure through the grappling hook. The King of Red Lions, the ship Link uses to traverse the Great Sea, is unique in that it can talk. Though it lacks the depth of other titles on this list, Wind Waker is a superb sailing game in its own righ.

5 Sailaway: The Sailing Simulator

The Most Authentic Sailing Experience

  • Release Date: April 25, 2017
  • Developers: Orbcreation
  • Platforms: PC and Mac

More of a full-blown simulator than a game, Sailway: The Sailing Simulator is a unique open-world sailing experience with a mission to teach enthusiasts how to sail. Of all the games on this list, Sailway is the most authentic sailing experience.

Featuring an individual open world that simulates the globe's oceans with the utmost accuracy, Sailway is a voyager's dream with in-depth mechanics and features for racing against others in real-time. Players can also assemble a crew to race. The simulator has around 500,000 buoys and navigational elements to direct players across the world's oceans. Sailway: The Sailing Simulator is the most faithful sailing game on the market, targeted toward a niche audience of hardcore enthusiasts.

4 Sea of Thieves

The Best Live Service Sailing Adventure

Sea of Thieves is a live-service, open-world sailing game that captured the hearts of gamers when it launched exclusively on Xbox consoles in 2020. Sea of Thieves took a while to find its sea legs due to initially lackluster content, but has since found its stride.

Approaching its 13th season, Sea of Thieves is an excellent pirate sailing game that players can enjoy with friends in online multiplayer. Whether fighting the Kraken with Sea of Thieves' best weapons, drinking from the local tavern, or laughing as a friend shoots himself out a cannon, the title is a blast and one of the sailing genre's best live service games.

3 Skull and Bones

The Best-Looking Open World Sailing Game

Announced in 2017 and released in February 2024 after a tumultuous development, Skull and Bones was the spiritual successor to the beloved sailing gameplay of Assassin's Creed: Black Flag . Despite a rocky start, Skull and Bones is a great open-world sailing game with extensive ship and character customization that is currently unrivaled in the sailing genre. It's a live-service game with breathtaking graphics and heart-pounding gameplay.

Although one of the most graphically inspiring titles on this list with gameplay to match, some players feel that Skull and Bones lacks variety, and that sticking to one-lane ship combat becomes tedious. Still, Skull and Bones makes up for it with its mechanics, which include building a smuggling empire and hunting hostile wildlife.

2 Assassin's Creed: Black Flag

The Best Pirate Sailing Game

One of the best and longest Assassin's Creed Games, Black Flag , expanded on previous titles to introduce improved sailing mechanics. Manning the notorious Jackdaw ship, Black Flag , players traverse the seas of the West Indies as the famed pirate and assassin Edward Kenway.

In this swashbuckling adventure with excellent sailing mechanics, players can shoot cannons, board enemy ships, and pillage vessels in the name of a pirate's life. Black Flag is one of the best open-world sailing games, featuring numerous islands to explore, treasures to find, and classic sea shanties to get players in the pirate mood. It is an outstanding sailing game that has something for everyone.

1 Sid Meier's Pirates (2004)

Setting Sail for Strategic Brilliance in Open-World Sailing Mastery

Sid Meier's Pirates (2004) holds a fond place in the hearts of gamers. A remake of the 1987 Sid Meier's Pirates , the title overhauled the original game with updated realistic 3D graphics, new mini-games, and improved combat. The remake was released on numerous consoles and on handheld devices such as the Apple iPad. The title is the king of pirate games, featuring superb naval battles and exploration across the game's Caribbean islands.

The features in Sid Meier's Pirates a re endless, with the ability to marry and engage in 1-1 combat, adding to immersion. At its heart, Sid Meier's Pirates is a strategy game with character, enabling players to engage in strategic battles at sea and on land. Sid Meier's Pirates is the complete package of open-world storytelling, sailing, strategy, and gameplay.

item.title: 10 Best Games You Can Play For 1000+ Hours
item.description:
Highlights

  • No Man's Sky offers endless exploration with over 18 quintillion planets, keeping players engaged for countless hours.
  • Fortnite's evolving map, crossovers, and game modes ensure a fresh and exciting experience for all players.
  • League of Legends ' strategic depth and constant updates captivate players for thousands of hours in unique matches.

Some games stand out not just for captivating stories or stunning graphics, but for their ability to keep players engaged for countless hours. Equipped with immense replay value, rich in content and ever-changing experiences, they can keep players interested for an almost endless amount of time.

Although games in this category are more commonly associated with online experiences, where players are constantly challenged to face opponents and surpass their own skills, many offline games also offer similar experiences. These titles have something special that keeps players coming back for more, providing endless entertainment and challenges to explore and master, and causing the hours to melt away.

10 No Man's Sky

Survive In Space

Since its initial release in 2016, No Man's Sky has undergone numerous updates and transformations, evolving into a rich experience that can captivate players for countless hours. Set in a procedurally generated universe with over 18 quintillion planets (give or take), the game offers virtually endless opportunities for exploration and discovery.

Traveling from planet to planet, each with its own unique ecosystem, flora, and fauna, players gather resources, build bases, and unravel the mysteries of the cosmos. Furthermore, the game also features a significant effort by the developers to keep the community active, with Hello Games constantly releasing new free updates that further expand on the available content and contribute to the game's longevity.

9 Fortnite

Epic Battles, Endless Fun

Fortnite has become a cultural phenomenon since its release in 2017. Known for its blend of battle royale action and creative building mechanics, the game offers dynamic gameplay that keeps players coming back for more. In addition, Fortnite has partnered with many other companies, franchises, and artists to bring some incredible crossovers to the game.

Besides these new features, the map evolves with each season, introducing new locations, challenges, and story elements, ensuring that the environment feels fresh and exciting for all players, all the time. Recently, Fortnite has also become a hub for other game modes, such as LEGO, which is essentially the game's take on Minecraft, and Festival, which is reminiscent of the old Rock Band series.

8 League Of Legends

Team Up And Dominate

League of Legends has been a staple in the multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) genre since 2009. Known for its strategic depth, competitive gameplay, and diverse roster of over 140 champions, the game offers an experience that can captivate players for thousands of hours.

Each match is unique, requiring players to collaborate with their teammates during different phases of the game to overcome their opponents. Riot also invests in keeping the game fresh through balance updates and the release of new champions, constantly bringing new elements to Summoner's Rift.

7 Minecraft

Build Your Adventure

Minecraft is more than just a game; it's a phenomenon that has captivated millions of players worldwide since its release in 2011. Developed by Mojang Studios, this sandbox game offers unparalleled creative freedom, allowing the construction of anything imaginable, from simple houses to elaborate cities and automations made with Redstone.

What truly sets Minecraft apart is its endless replayability, making it popular among a massive variety of players and communities. Regular updates from the developers introduce new functionalities to the game, such as blocks, biomes, mobs, and mechanics, while the active modding community provides a constant stream of new content, ensuring the game never feels stale.

6 Stardew Valley

Farm Life, Your Way

Stardew Valley allows an escape from the hustle and bustle of modern life by moving to the countryside to restore a neglected farm. Despite the concept being clichÃ©, and used by many other games in the farming sim genre, this title has its charm. With open-ended gameplay, players engage in a variety of activities such as farming, fishing, mining, crafting, all while building relationships with the townsfolk.

Regular updates, including the addition of a multiplayer mode, and a passionate modding community, introduce new content and features, even creating a new village which further expands the game's content. Stardew Valley offers endless possibilities for exploration, making it a game that provides countless hours of enjoyment.

5 Monster Hunter World

Hunt Giant Monsters

Taking place across gigantic maps, Monster Hunter World challenges players to hunt a variety of dangerous monsters, and then use the parts of those monsters to craft stronger gear and weapons. Each monster hunt is a strategic battle, requiring the study of quarries, the preparation of the right equipment, and the execution of well-timed attacks.

The longevity of Monster Hunter World is driven by its rewarding gameplay loop. Countless hours are spent mastering different weapon types, crafting and upgrading gear from harvested materials, and learning the patterns and weaknesses of each monster. Additionally, the franchise's games usually have an incredible selection of creatures that can be hunted, further increasing the time spent playing them.

4 Crusader Kings 3

Rule Your Dynasty

Crusader Kings 3 is a grand strategy role-playing game set in the Middle Ages. Player choices, from marriages to assassinations, can shape the course of history for centuries. This complexity and depth make it a title capable of easily consuming over a thousand hours of gameplay.

The game offers an unparalleled level of immersion, delving into the lives of medieval rulers. Every character has a unique personality, traits, and ambitions, leading to countless emergent and unpredictable storylines. When players are tired of the conventional Medieval experience, they can also turn to mods, which make total conversions to the scenarios, taking them to other universes, such as Westeros or Tamriel.

3 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Adventure Awaits In Skyrim

One of the best games ever produced by Bethesda, The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim was a significant milestone in the open-world RPG genre, offering players a lot of content and unmatched replayability for the era. With a vast, detailed world filled with countless secrets and adventures, hundreds of hours can be easily lost exploring every nook and cranny.

What sets Skyrim apart is its ability to adapt to any playstyle. Whether players want to be a stealthy archer, a powerful mage, or a two-handed warrior, Skyrim has something for everyone. The story is also non-linear, allowing the main objectives to be completed according to the players' own timeline, with many never even defeating Alduin (the final boss) and preferring to consume the optional content instead.

2 Grand Theft Auto 5

Los Santos Is A Playground

Grand Theft Auto 5 offers an open-world experience unlike any other. Set in the sprawling metropolis of Los Santos, unprecedented freedom to explore is granted to players, allowing them to either cause chaos, or simply live a virtual life.

The game's longevity is largely due to its robust multiplayer mode, Grand Theft Auto Online , which continually evolves with new updates and content. A wide range of activities are available, including cooperative missions, competitive races, and a host of dynamic events.

1 Final Fantasy 14

Explore Eorzea With Your Friends

Final Fantasy 14 is a critically acclaimed MMORPG that has captured the adoration of gamers worldwide since its relaunch in 2013. Set in the expansive fantasy world of Eorzea, the game offers a rich narrative experience combined with deep gameplay mechanics and character customization options.

FF14 features multiple expansion packs, each adding new areas, storylines, and gameplay elements. The ongoing addition of new content, including seasonal events, expansion packs, and major patches, ensures that there's always something new to explore or experience.

item.title: Fire Emblem Heroes: How to Reroll
item.description:
Despite being a tactical RPG game, Fire Emblem Heroes â€™ gacha mechanics for collecting new Heroes has been one of its popular features. But with so many different character pools, getting a top-tier warrior is quite a challenge. Luckily, thereâ€™s one method beginner players can use to guarantee rare character pulls right off the bat : rerolling Fire Emblem Heroesâ€™ early summons. This guide explains how you can do so by replaying the gameâ€™s tutorials a few times.

Fire Emblem Heroesâ€™ Reroll Explained

Like most RPG games with gacha mechanics, Fire Emblem Heroes allows players to pull for a couple of new characters at the start of the campaign. Some players exploit this opportunity to reroll heroes and get a five-star character before starting the main missions.

In Fire Emblem Heroes , thereâ€™s a three to eight percent chance of getting a five-star Hero, depending on the Banner Focus. (Legendary and Mythic Hero Focuses yield the highest drop rate, which is eight percent.) When rerolling, you try to abuse the gameâ€™s summoning mechanics so that it gives you a rare drop from the get-go. You do this by reusing the initial Orbs the game gives you for completing the tutorials.

How to Reroll in Fire Emblem Heroes

To initiate a reroll in Fire Emblem Heroes , follow these instructions:

  1. Refuse to link your game account to your Nintendo account . At the start of the game, choose â€œLink Later.â€
  2. Complete the tutorial missions . They are relatively short and can be beaten in one minute or two.
  3. Claim all Starter Support Presents to get up to 39 Orbs . You must interact with the owl in your â€œHomeâ€ to get these rewards.
  4. Claim your free five-star Heroes from the Wave of Fate banner . You can have up to two top-tier Heroes as a starter support pack.
  5. Pull for Legendary Heroes or draw from a beginner banner . Hero Fest is also a good banner thanks to its boosted five-star drop rates.
  6. Uninstall and reinstall the game and repeat steps one to three for a chance to re-roll . You will need to re-download the game. (Choose the lite version to save data.)

The downside of this rerolling method is that it requires you to re-download the game data every time you attempt a reroll. Of course, those playing on a rooted Android or jailbroken iOS device can manually remove their account info and repeat rolling without uninstalling the game.

If you did pull your desired characters after a reroll, remember to link your account to Nintendo so you donâ€™t lose your progress. (On the title screen, tap â€œMenuâ€ and select â€œAccount Managementâ€.)

What to Prioritize When Rerolling

You should prioritize pulling from banner focuses with the highest five-star drop rates. The â€œLegendary Heroes Are Here!â€ is one good example of such a banner. You should aim to pull S-Tier characters like Byleth, Alfonse, Shez, Serior, or Robin. Itâ€™s recommended you donâ€™t settle for four-star Heroes, even though you can ascend them to five stars later.
